סלעים עתיקים חושפים מתי נהרות החלו לשפוך חומרים מזינים לים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/ancient-rocks-rivers-nutrients-seLucas Van Wyk Joel Fri, 31 Jan 2025 15:45:00 +0000Earth https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149372 Rivers began pumping weathered material into the sea about a billion years after Earth formed, suggesting continents may have gotten an early start. 3149372
בבונים פרועים לא מזהים את עצמם במראה https://www.sciencenews.org/article/wild-baboons-mirror-recognize-testBethany Brookshire Fri, 31 Jan 2025 14:00:00 +0000Animals https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149425 In a lab test, chimps and orangutans can recognize their own reflection. But in the wild, baboons seemingly can’t do the same. 3149425
מגרד גירוד זה כל כך טוב, וכל כך רע https://www.sciencenews.org/article/scratching-atch-good-badLaura Sanders Thu, 30 Jan 2025 19:00:00 +0000Neuroscience https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149623 The motion kicks off inflammation but may also combat harmful bacteria 3149623
גלאי נייטרינו זעיר קלע בגדול בכור גרעיני https://www.sciencenews.org/article/neutrino-detector-nuclear-reactorEmily Conover Thu, 30 Jan 2025 17:30:00 +0000Particle Physics https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149321 A compact method of detecting neutrinos provides new tests of physics theories and could lead to new reactor-monitoring methods. 3149321
האכלת כרישים 'זבל אוכל' גובה מחיר את בריאותם https://www.sciencenews.org/article/sharks-junk-food-health-touristsJake Buehler Thu, 30 Jan 2025 15:45:00 +0000Animals https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3148933 Many blacktip reef sharks in French Polynesia are commonly fed by tourists. But the low-quality diet is changing the sharks’ behavior and physiology. 3148933
מניעת הריון זכרית טובה יותר היא באופק https://www.sciencenews.org/article/male-birth-control-contraceptive-spermFred Schwaller Thu, 30 Jan 2025 14:00:00 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149359 Men have two birth control options: condoms and vasectomies. Why has it taken so long to develop more contraceptives? 3149359
טראמפ מורה לזרוע כאוס בבריאות הציבור העולמית https://www.sciencenews.org/article/trump-pepfar-hiv-global-public-healthMeghan Rosen Wed, 29 Jan 2025 20:30:00 +0000Science & Society https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149540 A recent flurry of executive orders and surprise actions by the Trump administration have roiled WHO, the CDC and the international public health community. 3149540
מרכיבי החיים נמצאו בדגימות של אסטרואיד בנו https://www.sciencenews.org/article/lifes-ingredients-asteroid-bennu-nasaAdam Mann Wed, 29 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000Space https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149474 Samples from NASA’s OSIRIS-REx mission show the asteroid Bennu had organic molecules and minerals and possibly salty water and other life ingredients. 3149474
כך הפכו אמזונאים קדומים לחקלאי תירס מאסטר https://www.sciencenews.org/article/maize-farmers-amazonians-casarabeBruce Bower Wed, 29 Jan 2025 16:00:00 +0000Archaeology https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149430 Casarabe people grew the nutritious crop year-round on savannas thanks to networks of drainage canals and ponds. 3149430
האם אתה באמת יכול למות מלב שבור? https://www.sciencenews.org/article/heartbreak-death-takotsubo-syndromeBethany Brookshire Wed, 29 Jan 2025 14:00:00 +0000Health & Medicine https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149352 Death by heartbreak doesn't just happen in stories. In real life, severe stress can cause the sometimes-fatal takotsubo syndrome. 3149352
עטלפים פטפטים נוטים יותר לקחת סיכונים https://www.sciencenews.org/article/bat-vocalization-soceralities- ריכוניםRichard Kemeny Wed, 29 Jan 2025 00:01:00 +0000Animals https://www.sciencenews.org/?p=3149419 Bats may broadcast their personalities to others from a distance, new experiments suggest, which could play into social dynamics within a colony. 3149419
